intro: Bancalus sericeus, commonly known as the silky longhorned beetle, is a species of beetle belonging to the family Cerambycidae. It is characterized by its elongated body and distinctive, silky appearance, with a metallic sheen that varies from reddish-brown to black. The adult beetle is typically found in forested areas, where it feeds on decaying wood and plant material. Its larvae also develop in moist, decaying wood, contributing to the decomposition process in forest ecosystems. This species plays a role in nutrient cycling and is often associated with specific tree species in its habitat.
